sections.content: This lesson focuses on creating and testing workflow rules and actions within the CRM. You'll learn how automations can perform updates, send notifications, and trigger related tasks to streamline your sales processes.
**Slide Deck:** Actions and Workflow Rules Presentation
Your instructor will demonstrate creating and testing workflow rules and actions. This section shows how automations work in real-time within the CRM.

items: An example of a workflow rule already in action
How to create a new workflow rule that performs a simple action (field update or tag)
The rule executing within the CRM in real-time

sections.content: Now it's your turn to create a workflow rule that welcomes new leads and notifies the Lead Owner.

items: Follow along with the instructor or spend five minutes building the rule yourself
Create a workflow rule triggered when a new lead is created
Configure the rule to send a welcome email to the lead
Set up a notification to alert the Lead Owner
Trigger the rule by creating a test lead
Review the resulting email and actions in the record timeline

sections.content: Next, you'll create a second rule for the Email module that demonstrates conditional automation.

items: Create a workflow rule for the **Email** module
Set the trigger: when the subject of the previous rule's email is replied to
Configure the workflow to **schedule a task automatically**
This creates a seamless follow-up sequence when leads respond

sections.content: Workflow rules can trigger various types of actions. Understanding these action types helps you build more sophisticated automations.

items: The different types of actions available in workflow automation
How to create a **Task** action and save it for reuse across multiple workflows
Using **merge fields** in tasks to personalize automated actions
**Important:** Tasks can be reused as saved actions, but Meetings and Calls cannot
Notification actions can be sent to the lead, and you can add additional recipients
Building complete sequences by adding multiple actions (emails, tasks, etc.) to a single workflow

sections.content: Now we'll pivot to explore another automation feature that ties into Workflow Rules. Technically, this is a different feature, but it's a good time to introduce how it works with workflows.

What do you do when you're generating about 100 leads a day, and you have 7 sales people? How do you distribute leads evenly? Better yet, how do you distribute your mid-market or enterprise leads among ONLY your top sales representatives?
The answer to this challenge is **Assignment Rules**.
Assignment rules allow you to distribute records to owners in a round-robin fashion or based on specific criteria you define.

items: If **Region = EST**, assign to users on your EST team
If **Annual Revenue is >50k**, assign to a dedicated user or team
Round-robin distribution across all sales representatives for balanced workload

sections.content: You'll now create a workflow rule that uses an Assignment Rule as its action.

items: When a deal reaches a certain stage, it's automatically assigned to a team responsible for collecting contract signatures
Routing specific record types to designated users or departments for handling
Distributing leads based on geography, industry, or company size
Assignment rules work **automatically** only for records created via **Import, API, and Webforms**

These must be configured to run automatically: API must contain a line to trigger assignment rules, Webforms must have a toggle turned "on" and the rule defined, and Import must have a box checked before completing the import
For **manually created records**, we can tie the Assignment rule to a Workflow Rule to automate the process

sections.content: Next, you'll demonstrate creating a workflow rule that uses **Scoring Rules** as the trigger.
If a lead's score drops below a defined threshold (for instance, due to email bounces or lack of engagement), the workflow could:

items: Send an automated email to re-engage the lead, or
Create a follow-up task or call reminder for the owner to verify the lead's interest or contact information
Similar to Assignment rules, but scores the lead based on engagement and activity
**Why Lead scoring is relevant:** Helps track which leads are most engaged and sales-ready
**How it's used:** Better tracking of engaged leads, prioritization of hot prospects, and automated nurturing of cold leads

sections.content: After completing this lesson, you should be able to:

items: Create workflow rules with various triggers and actions
Build multi-step automation sequences with email and task actions
Use merge fields to personalize automated communications
Implement Assignment Rules to distribute leads fairly and strategically
Set up Scoring Rules to track lead engagement
Explain when Assignment Rules apply automatically vs. when they need workflow triggers
